description: From Middle English unlovely, onlovely, unlovelich, equivalent to un- +‎ lovely.

examples: […]  an ocean of dereliction, blackened tenements, public drunkenness, dozens of unlovely skyscrapers, featureless housing schemes. It was as if this was all that Glasgow deserved. And yet the city still had a lot of bazazz.

entries.meaning: An unattractive or ugly thing or person.
examples: A hairless runt of a mutt named Chi-chi defeated them all in the 13th annual Ugliest Dog in the World contest: such unlovelies as the moth-eaten chow and the bulldog with a bad eye.
